page.title: 02WIVELISCOMBE SQUARE SCHEME
page.content: 1985 has seen a great improvement in the appearance of Wiveliscombe.The Square enhancement scheme for the town centre has been carried out at an estimated cost of Â£35000.The people of the parish paid a 2p rate,raising Â£4500,whilst the remainder was financed by Taunton Deane and the Somerset County Council.The triangular part of the square,used for parking, was paved over.New red lamp posts were erected,young trees planted and benches installed.One side of the Square is occupied by London House.It was a drapers and was purchased for road widening,but was left to decay. In 1984/85 it was renovated and converted into flats and shops.Our survey revealed that the majority thought the Square much better although a few though it was a waste of space.Some disliked the positioning
